caption: Great place excellent service good food.

Sizzling Crab Cake & WhoDat Shrimp was delicious.  I expected the steak to be better..... The waiter was all of the place. Guess it was too busy for him. Wasn't expecting Mr. JOHN STEAKHOUSE to be a part of Desi Vega. The waiter didn't know anything about the bar & couldn't recommend any drinks. Hopefully if I return, I will get somebody more knowledgeable

Tony and Darrell did a great job taking care of us.  We started with The Who Dat Shrimp appetizer very good choice to start with.  Then we ordered. 12oz Ribeye to split with each having our own 8oz Lobster Tail.  We chose the Onion Strings and Sweet Potato Soufflé both very good, Soufflé could have been our dessert.  Onion Strings went to waste not because they weren’t good it was just too much food and we had to focus on the Steak and Lobster.  Was disappointed because I was too full to have dessert they had 2 of my favorites I would have loved to have tried.  Bread Pudding with no raisins and Creme Brûlée. We don’t spend this much at dinner too often so I kept reading reviews on several places and decided on this one.  So glad I made the right choice.
Excellent
Only one word !!! Great
When at a steak house. . order the steak.  We had 4 appitizers and all but one was less than even good.  Next time, getting the fillet.
Great food... cozy atmosphere...

Try the house salad and turtle soup. Also, order the cut of steak that you prefer even if it's not the signature one. You will be much more satisfied with it (per the person with whom I was dining). I got the sense the waiter did not like that person but, as a former server at a country club, I also sensed why haha. Still, I liked my experience at another steakhouse in the quarter better so that's why 4 instead of 5 stars.
Great steakhouse and very nice people.  Hard to get a table on some nights due to its popularity.
Great food Great service
Great old School  steakhouse. Just wonderful

We just left I couldn’t wait to write a review, we were there celebrating our 25th Anniversary The Food was good no complaints but I couldn’t stand our  waiter Borris, he didn’t say thank you or you’re welcome, he seemed as if we were aggravating him by asking simple questions And it seems to me we (black ppl) was being treated totally different from his white customers Won’t be going back
MEAT
Awesome food, the staff had taken very good care of me and the other member of my group.
The Food Was Great & Awesome Customer Service! 👌
The meal was good but the service was terrible.
Great service and excellent food. Such a treat.
Great place to visit plus the food and staff was awesome.

I love new Orleans for the diversity but being seated in the far corner of the restaurant with my husband's chair shoved underneath the tv was pretty blatant. We made reservations and the restaurant was empty we got there while it was opening. The hostess lady looked us over a few times then placed us in the corner. When my husband asked the waitor Jimmy for another table he claimed all the others were taken.. even though all table were open but they promptly placed the white patrons at the open tables. It kind of soured the entire visit and I was disappointed in Mr. Johns. It's 2020 you guys. And don't think people of color don't notice the change in treatment and service. My husband and I are both professionals holding several degrees between us. Treat everyone with respect and dignity regardless of skin tone. The food was just alright, if there was a taste test between them and longhorn steakhouse I wouldn't know the difference. A big let down bc my husband and I have been wanting to check this place out for a while now. I'm sure the restaurant will comment with a robotic response but seriously guys....listen.
Great steak, quaint little place
Service and food was excellent, the atmosphere very relaxing every one had a good time..
Annual birthday tradition for my spouse.  We are never disappointed.  While the food is delicious, the attentiveness and personalities of the wait staff definitely make the experience even better!
The best food I have ever had! The ribeye was to die for! Our server I believe was William who was awesome!
Excellent service, great ambiance, and prime steaks
Great, cozy spot for an excellent meal!

I had been meaning to go here for a while and never actually made it in. I got the opportunity though last week to eat here with a few friends and it might now be my favorite steak house in New Orleans.

Dinner was exquisite, but comfortable. Boris our waiter was courteous, attentive and professional. The food was delicious...simply scrumptious. The filet mignon was like cotton candy it was so tender, and with the favor the  use of an additional sauce isn't necessary. The heart iceberg lettuce was so very fresh and special thousand Island dressing with bacon, pepper and also other ingredients made a savoring moment. I close my eyes on several occasions. Five stars for the Chelf and kitchen. I would like to also appauled the Bar Tender whom made a Whiskey Sour my Sister said, just like my Dad, "Superb"  may he rest in peace. Last my Sister and I shared a Brownie Alamo, and Willy Wonka had nothing on this rich chocolate.
Every thing about this place is superb! The food from start to finish was amazing.  The steak was mouthwatering and melt in your mouth delicious.  I will definitely be back.
Good food but poor customer service. Problem with take out order tried to contact manager but never contacted me.
Delicious well season and piping hot!!! I will definitely be back.

Very classy environment. I haven't eaten meat in 4 weeks. They  accommodated me with a very tasty vegetable medley. Mushrooms tasted like steak. Staff very attentive. Ran into some friends I have not seen for quite some time. I highly recommended eating at Mr. John's Steakhouse.
The sweet potato souffle taste like Christmas
Will was our waiter and he was outstanding. He went above and beyond.  Our food was amazing as usual. Perfect birthday celebration. Thanks Mr. Johns
Excellent service, amazing food. Best steakhouse in Nola.
Excellent place for sophisticated food and superior service
Had a wonderful Porterhouse Steak with some delicious desserts. But the crab cake! The Crab cake was out of this world!
Haven't been in awhile... forgot how 🔥🔥🔥 it was. Came with 3 friends. Spectacular!!!
The Whodat shrimp were awesome! The steaks were good, but then again for the price they should be better. I had the NY Strip- should have ordered the filet I think.
Absolutely great. Jimmy  Jim was the ultimate gentleman and waiter . We will definitely come back. The Timothy Moragne   party.  5 stars for sure.

My cousin had made reservations for this place to celebrate her 35th birthday. As someone who loves Gooood food and flavors this place did not meet my expectations. I'm used to "Ruth Chris Steakhouse" where the steak is seasoned and I need nothing  else with it. Mr. John's only season with salt and pepper as stated on the menu. Welp, I guess my cousin missed that part when she told me this place was New Orleans' version of my favorite steakhouse. Not so, this place doesn't compair. Now I must say the service was EXCELLENT and for that I will rate this place 2/5 even though I wasted $70 on dinner that I didnt enjoy.
Best restaurant to have an ultimate Valentine's experience

Great meal! Was able to share a perfectly prepared ribeye with my husband, share a delicious baked potato, and creamed spinach. Good service, possibly a bit rushed -- brought our wine before we were done with our cocktail. Other than that, everything was perfect!
Been to a lot of steak restaurants in my life and this is by far the best one yet. Service was great and steak melted in my mouth.

Is this my favorite steak? No, but it's delicious and they serve some great martinis. The vegan friendly pasta my friend got was amazing and, honestly, I'm a bit jealous I didn't ask for the same. But who wants vegetables and matinis?

This is my favorite restaurant for steak. The Filet is excellent. Very difficult to deviate from the Filet.  A magnificent appetizer is their so called Who Dat Shrimp. Their version of Shrimp en Brochette. Divine.  Everyone is so nice and the service is always attentive without being intrusive.  During lunch Phil runs the show while Kari will make your drink order at the bar just right.  If you move away from New Orleans this will be a place that you miss.
Totally over rated. Food average at best. Service is slow. Noisy and crowded. No plans to go back. Nothing special about this place.
Great service, great food...
Can't go wrong with Mr. John's Steakhouse - excellent cut of meat.  Have to try the Louis XIII at least one time!
Really great food, just as with the rest of the restaurants in this 'family'
My favorite steakhouse in New Orleans. Great food, good service, and free valet parking.
Great food! Service was good as well. Its definitely the best Steakhouse in  New Orleans.

the steaks were tuff not prime. i had a group from work boat show 6 persons. did not say anything because did not want to ruin a great time but after dinner ask my son and general manager and ask said same thing tuff steak. great service left 140.00 tip. we were at ruth chris the night before and all was great melt in your mouth cut with a fork steaks. very disappointed with mr johns  . chris total bill 840.00 no problem
My favorite place for steak in New Orleans.
Wow!  Great food, great drinks!  Dont miss out, this is a must go place in NOLA

Dinner was lovely, however We were witness to a very unpleasant situation. A gentleman in the restaurant received severe burns on his fingers because his plate was too hot. We spoke with them  outside after and his fingers were blistering. Upon talking to the manager about it,the  manager proceeded to yell at this gentleman. Enough so that other patrons could hear what was going on. The discussion got very heated. And rather than show concern for this customer the manager blamed him and said that he was warned that the plate was hot. The gentleman was told that it was taken directly out of the broiler and given to him. Having worked in the restaurant industry for many years, it is common practice to transfer the hot food to a warming plate or put a plate underneath it to avoid such burns. Nothing should be served to a customer on a plate so hot that it causes blistering burns on your fingers. The manager did not handle it well. It was a very uncomfortable situation.
Best docking steak IV ever had. Excellent service.
Awesome food, awesome service, awesome ambiance!
Had the ribeye steak oscar style, the fried tomatoes with crab topping and a glass of wine. Excellent food and service.
One of two Steak Houses that we will only eat at in New Orleans by far Great Food, Service, atmosphere, all are on point. Keep up the Great work Desi.
Over rated......the waiter was horrible

Our waiter was very rude and loud. We had a misunderstanding with our groupon and instead of him being professional and explaining it whereas we were the only ones to hear him. There was two other tables starring at me and my wife. I have never been so embarrassed at a dinner table.

Not the worst experience but definitely not what I so Love about our Great City either. Waiter was not very friendly and food was average. NOT a Local place I would send my out of  town guest for a NOLA Fine dining experience
WOW!!!.. Sizzling steak, nice atmosphere,  nice waiter...what more could you want???...oh..in same hotel....life is good.
Excellent! Probably in my top 10 list of places to eat.
GREAT -  food, atmosphere and service!!

(Translated by Google) The food was good, the steak was very good. The prices in our opinion are far too high, not justified. Annotation: We think the city lives on tourists. Tourists are usually not traveling with suit and tie. You feel quite uncomfortable here in the tourist outfit.  (Original) Das Essen war gut, das Steak war sehr gut. Die Preise sind unserer Meinung nach viel zu hoch, nicht gerechtfertigt. Anmerkung: Wir denken die Stadt lebt von Touristen. Touristen sind in der Regel nicht mit Anzug und Krawatte unterwegs.  Man fühlt sich hier im Touristen-Outfit doch recht unwohl.

I'm a little confused about the negative reviews - especially the ones concerning the staff. We went there for our anniversary. It was a last-minute choice, so we didn't have reservations, but they were able to accommodate us anyway.  The staff couldn't have been better. They waited on us hand and foot. The food was great. I'm not sure what more you could ask for.
Spectacular! Rib eye with blue cheese....just do it!
Had ate out for my sibling's birthday. Great service. Attentive wait staff.
Awesome ribeye
Wonderful food and service. Very nice dining experience @ Mr. John's!
Good steak and service.
Oh my word the steak, salad, soup and fries where delicious. I went there for my birthday dinner. Great service and cozy atmosphere.
Fried green tomato appetizer was awesome.  My husband had the filet mignon it was delicious and I had Veal Alyssa.  Would highly recommend this place.  Great atmosphere waiter Jimmy very personable.
Amazing food and service
The food was great, the steak was super tender and juicy, was able to make a special request. My Groupon was really easy to use. Will return.
T Took my son here before he left for college. The hostess was less than friendly. Our servers Boris and John were great. The crabcakes are a must. Very meaty and tasty.
Excellent
Great place to eat steak out of this world 👍
Impeccable.
Beautiful, classic Italian steakhouse with old world charm and attentive service.
NY strip was very good.  A bit mellow taste.  I fondly remember blackened NY strip when it was a chef's special.  Service was great.

We had been looking forward to dining here for months! First, the food and aesthetics of the restaurant were wonderful. It has an old school steak house feel, it reminded me of Crescent City Steaks, just more modern. It's so disheartening and disrespectful in 2019 to still deal with blatantly different service in a fine dining establishment due to race (it was the only difference between us and the other restaurant patrons). Especially in a city whose main economic draw is tourism. Either they don't realize you notice it or maybe they just don't give a f÷@%! I can only speak on the experience we had at this restaurant, if our treatment was due to something other than race we could not identify it. We dine out a lot, everything from holes in the wall to fine dining establishments and sadly this type of treatment is still very prevalent. We pride ourselves on being exceptional tippers 20% is our norm. I will tip a lackluster server no less than 15%. I tip this way because I understand they don't think "we" are tipping at all let alone tipping properly. Needless to say, we won't be back anytime soon. I will say we have dined at their sister restaurant Desi Vega and the service was amazing!
Fresh food. Friendly service
Great place for an exquisite Dinner! Side dishes and drinks were out of this world. Great atmosphere!
Great service!!! Steaks were fantastic and cooked to perfection! All food was beautifully served and mac and cheese was phenomenal! Definitely 5 stars!
Delicious food and great service! Always a pleasure!
Best restaurant in new Orleans
Best steak I've had in NOLA
Best steak I've had in NOLA. Drinks are strong and service is top notch!
Good food, great service.
Good food and service.  Reasonable prices and food choices.
Steak was best quality. One of the most tender I've ever eaten. Great service.
Phenomenal steak. Excellent bartenders. Great wine list.
Everything I wanted to entertainy guest Loved the steak Loved the ambience Quiet for ease of conversation
The best
Yup notch all the way around.
I have had steak cooked by the Executive Chef, Jordan Garcia, and have never had a bad one.  Always cooked to perfection.  Even got a tour of the kitchen!!!!
Too loud, inattentive service....
Class act steak house with excellent fish to go with their meats. Had the mahi could not have been fresher

If you love steak, this place is your jam. A great local NOLA favorite, that even my family from Mobile, Alabama stop for whenever we take the 2 hour drive to New Orleans. It has a great atmosphere, between good old New Orleans's style and upper class dining. The special seafood bisque they had was amazing, my entire family got a bowl and then we split two steaks and two sides. The staff were very kind and my dad and uncle love going there.
Best steak in New Orleans,  bar none! Wait staff was excellent. Even the valet drivers were friendly😊. Will definitely ne back!!!!

Exceptional service! They serve you all at the same time and your water glass is never empty! The French onion soup is the best I've ever had and the steak is excellent! They start you with a meatball that was so good I could have asked for seconds. If you need to use the restroom you have to go through the kitchen which is a very cool tour but awkward coming back. Lots of dessert options, I only had the Creme Brulee which was top of my list! Perfect romantic atmosphere.

Filet is excellent.  Perfectly cooked and tasted great. I recommend one side or salad, not both, as the portions are large. We had a wonderful date her while on vacation. Only downside to Mr. John's as it is very loud when the restaurant is full.
Best steak I've had in a while.
Outstanding steak for peak prices. The spinach salad was really excellent. Their signature “Who Dat Shrimp” dish is super extra and delicious! We will be going again once my wallet has recovered.
Independent Steakhouses are the absolute best. Great food, service, and ambience. Love this place

Service was 12 out of 10 from start to finish. Our server Boris and his team were on point. Appetizers were unbelievable Who Dat shrimp and tuna dish were favorites. Steak was knockout served to perfection. I got the Filet topped with blue cheese. Unreal tenderness and flavor. We were there for a birthday and they made it a special one from the moment we walked in the door till we finished dessert that included a tira misu, red velvet brownie, and the best chocolate bread pudding in the city. See ya next time Mr. John's.
All the food was fantastic
Ribeye was best steak we've ever had.
Service was fantastic.   Sat in woodroom and the crew did a great job.   Food was great as well.

We loved Mr. John’s Steakhouse. We were visiting New Orleans to celebrate our anniversary and happened upon Mr. John’s!  The food was the best I have ever had in my life. The wine was also amazing. Our servers J.T. and Doug were ever so attentive and helpful in suggesting each course of our dinner.  We can’t wait to revisit on our next trip down to NOLA!

Wow , was just sitting at the bar with my husband, having a glass of wine waiting on our party. We have a 7:30 reservation and we got kicked off our barstools. Some one else had reserved those  ... ok sure . Do I need to spend money on dinner here with that hospitality?

AMAZING sevice, atmosphere, and food.  1st class!  I think it's the best steak in the city.  It is expensive, but you won't mind for what you get!   Aged USDA Prime at it's finest!  Sides and dessert are great too!  Valet parking makes it super easy!
Best food and drink presented by a great bartender! Reservations recommended and if you aren’t fortunate to get one then try sitting at the bar. Well worth it!

I like Mr John's, my dinner experience was a good one. Food was great, waiters were attentive. Only drawback is the dinner floor is open and every conversation is loud. But once you're over that. You'll love it. We were even offered an off the menu item that we loved. #Fantastic

Not a very special birthday dinner. Staff was unfriendly, we were sat at the only 2 topper on a very slow night. Food was rushed to us.as soon as appetizers were eaten, boom,next course.i felt constantly watched to see how soon they could get us out. Steaks were overcooked.knowing it was my husband's birthday and we could of picked any restaurant in the city,we chose Mr. John's. Big mistake. His big birthday special touch was them sticking a candle in his meatball,which are served complimentary to every guest. Hello people, we are locals and apparently I spread the word.we eat out 3-4 times a week.you people are bottom of the barrel. Thanks so much,but never again! I guess yall are so sure of your regular clientele that no one else deserves your supposedly 5 star treatment. Worse high end steak place in new Orleans! I actually went there several years back and was treated the same.thought we'd try again.should of gone to Chophouse! Now that's a great place that knows how to treat people spending $300 on a meal!

The food is great, on point however the atmosphere had more to be desired. There was a disconnect with our server, he was present, made sure we had everything we needed however was not outgoing at all. The server did make a mistake forgetting to prepare one of our steaks correctly, however did try to resolve the issue. The restaurant was extremely loud which also did not help. Expected more from a restaurant advertised to be of such a high caliber.

Food and drinks were exceptional. I wish we could bring their chef back to my hometown! Service was spot on for attentiveness, knowledge and friendliness. We will return to this steakhouse when back in New Orleans.
Great drinks,good food and great bartenders!
Very nice experience and Aaron was great
Best steaks in town.
Good!
excellent food and service.
Great steakhouse.  Great service and and everything was cooked perfectly.  Make sure you have reservations.

My second favorite steak I've ever had (1st is Manny's in MPLS). If you love steak, you have to come here. There is nothing more satisfying than simplicity. My steak came out sizzling on it's plate. Just a steak on a plate. Nothing else. Great atmosphere. Impeccable staff. If I ever get back to NOLA, I'll make it a point to get here.

Everything about Mr John’s was perfect, the bbq shrimp, the Caesar salad, the garlic mashed potatoes, the steak (possibly the best in New Orleans), and the service. Boris took thorough care of us all night and our steaks came straight off the grill still sizzling on our plates. The staff even brought us some meatballs with candles in them for our anniversary which was a very nice touch. We had previously been to Morton’s Steakhouse and Mr John’s makes Morton’s look like a glamorized pile of garbage.
Best steak I have ever had. Eat at the bar and get to know Sal and Carrie they will make the trip there worth it. Little on the expensive side but totally worth it.
Excellant food and service
Best steak around

The food was just delicious.  The calamari appetizer had an interesting twist.  The tomato /mozzarella salad is great for a split.  The 2 sides we had were hot and tasty.  We had the fish special, veal and a filet mignon at the table and they were all perfectly done!  To top it off, one of us had room for dessert and we all got to try it--then we wished we had more room.  Will certainly go back for another visit...
Great steaks and service staff
our server was condescending and was just annoying
Great service, great food
Amazing service, food, wine, and atmosphere!
Came here during my honeymoon and had one of the best steaks I've ever tasted. The customer service was excellent as well.
Love this place.. Great food... Great service
Great service, great food and great atmosphere
Terrific NY Strip Steak, Great Service
Great food service and a great time with Long time friends

I had a great time. Best fancy restaurant in New Orleans.  Now my favorite one. The service is amazing, attention to details, and clean. One of the waiters explains everything with a lot of knowledge, transport you to another country the way he express himself.  We ordered French Onion soup, fried tomatoes with crab meat, steak, pasta with shrimp and lobster,  and a delicious desert. I wish i can give them a 10. We didn't have reservation, but they gave us a table in less than 3 minutes. Recommended for a special occasion! !!.
A bit pricey, but very well worth it.
Best steak in New Orleans. Small place make reservations on the weekends
Great food!
Love, love Mr John's. Awesome service, great food. 5 stars, one of my favorite go to places in the city.
The food was delicious.

If I could leave a zero review I would. Let me start out with saying we were staying in the resort that this restaurant is located in. It’s a Friday night at 5:40 and we asked if we needed reservations and were told no. We proceed into the restaurant ten minutes after opening and mind you just a couple tables were being used were told that since we didn’t have a reservation it would be 9:15 before we could get a table. We then went out to our concierge at our Wyndham resort explaining our situation they immediately called Houston restaurant to see if we could get in and they said of course. We went there had a fabulous meal along with great music and a great vibe. As you can see I don’t leave reviews except when needed. So anyone staying on St. Charles in New Orleans go to the Houston restaurant. Stellar.
Great steaks cooked to perfection! I also suggest the Freddie Mac.

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is due to the fact of a few extremely loud tables in the restaurant. Other than that the food was delicious & our server Jimmy J was excellent. I'll most definitely be returning sometime soon & I'm asking for Jimmy when I do.

Groupon had a invalid use Saturday only the day we were there very sneaky very under minded they shouldn't even bother issuing these type of offers if they're going to have limitations and be imposed on clients or customers especially on the first visit very unhappy
Steak. Nuff said
Good taste. I ate ribeye and tasty
Scrumptious pieces of meat. Best steak in the city. Only rivaled by Brasa.
One of the best stake houses in town.

One of the best and underrated steak houses in New Orleans. Food is always superb and the service is outstanding! I would recommend going here prior to visiting some of the steak house chains like Ruth's Chris, Fleming's, etc.
Good food.  Pricey
Awesome lunchtime experience. Waitstaff was very attentive and the food was great.

It is my last day in New Orleans  and I decided to try this place because I stayed in the timeshare next to it. I can honestly say I have never been more disappointed in the results. I ordered my food the BBQ shrimp, and the Mr.John house salad to go. The salad did not taste fresh, my toast was soaked with juice because they put it in the same box as my shrimp which seemed like it was from someone else's meal and they just put it in a box to give me. I am so disappointed and when we tried to take it back to show the manager they gave us attitude! Never coming back or recominding it to anyone!!!
Amazing food and service, great view of St. Charles
Amazing!
Oh. My. Goodness. Perfection! Worth the trip to enjoy this gem.
Best steak in NOLA!!!  This from a western meat n potatoes guy!!!
Amazing experience. Wonderful customer service and the best steak in the city by far. Our new favorite restaurant.
Great neighborhood steak house. Nice and quiet off the beaten path. Service was impeccable and dont forget to have a meatball- absolutely amazing. Steaks and sides were perfectly cooked.
Always delicious. A real go-to for a nice steak dinner.
First class My New Orleans style steakhouse. Excellent wait staff.

This was one if tbe highlights of our new orleans trip. The food and service were fabulous. It lives up to its reputation.  If ypu are celebrating or just want a great steak dinner this is your best bet.  Oh and their mac n cheese with crawdads is amazing.
Traditional steakhouse, hits all the right chords.
Excellent service! Great steak

While most of the dinner was great there were some major problems which is why we will not be returning for a while. All of the food was great except for one filet that did not taste right that they had to remake. From the beginning the the manager wasn't kind or friendly about it but rather rude. Then it took 30-45 minutes to get the steak remade and by that time the rest of the party had finished their meals and half the party had left. I'm upset because I wanted to like this  restaurant as new alternative to Ruth Chris and Crescent City Steakhouses. When we paid we told the waiter that we knew it wasn't his fault and he was kind of rude about that but, thats what happens when someone does not a good leader to look up to.  I think this restaurant has great potential but needs a new manager.
Stopped in for drinks. The staff was so friendly! We will be back for dinner.

The atmosphere was a little louder than we were expecting. There were a lot of big groups and the tables were pretty close to each other. The servers were a little abrupt but overall friendly and helpful. They did a great job checking in with us, refilling water, and clearing plates in time. The shrimp,bacon appetizer they were upselling was extremely tasty but very heavy. The server made a great wine suggestion that paired perfectly with a divine new york strip (cooked to perfection) and the fish of the day (trout). Overall it was an extremely pleasant experience!

Overrated and overpriced. Yes it’s a high end place. The food is nothing too special. Server was impatient regarding allergies at the table and made several errors with dishes ordered. We’ve had better steaks in NYC and Vegas for far less... overall food was okay but the price just didn’t justify the food quality. Service was good and attentive.
One of the best steaks I have ever had in my life
An amazing restaurant for just about any occasion. Absolutely a top 3 steakhouse nationally in my eyes. Food and service was top notch!!

I called in advance to ask if it would be appropriate to bring our 20 month old. They were very nice and said they have high chairs. We went and had the best meal. Everyone was nice to us and our daughter - called her by name, we even got a tour of the kitchen! Amazing steaks and amazing service. Highly recommend.
Excellent steak with a great ambience

Went to celebrate my sister's  birthday,  I have never been in such a loud restaurant and all the yelling by customers and staff. I had a hard time hearing people at my own table.  I was disappointed  with my steak, it was dry,  as well as the fried green tomatoes, not cooked well, . The prices were extreme but that would have been okay if I had enjoyed the food more. Waiters were great until one complained because we wanted separate  checks.
The best steak I ever had. Get it Oscar style and rare, you won't regret it
SO GOOD! Went for my birthday and first time visiting New Orleans and it did not disappoint. The lobster and French onion soup  is amazing.
The food and service were second to none. Plan on  going back many times. Recmend skipping the desert portion. Was good but have had better. Order an extra app instead or go big with another entree!
Everything here is superb. The food, the service, & the ambiance. Highly recommend it.

If you're looking for the best steak in the city, this is it! Attentive and friendly staff. There are no bad choices on the menu. Sides are served family style. Be sure to get an order of the onion rings for the table to start. They're like none you've ever had.
Dine here many times. I can’t complain about the food here but the service is what making me rate this place a 4 and not 5
Service is wonderful prices are very high and food is ok but of course I had the chicken that was dry and they are a steakhouse.
Taste of the creation

My husband and I celebrated our ten-year wedding anniversary and my birthday at this establishment last night. He had the Braised Pork Belly (appetizer) and Ribeye (entree). I had the Turtle Soup (appetizer, first time eating) and the Two Lobster Tails (entree). Our meals were cooked to perfection. The wait staff was cheery, friendly, and attentive. Ambience was so nice. I wanted to cry because everything went to so well. Tip: get your car parked by the valet. I would come back to eat here again. I highly recommend this restaurant.
I never visit New Orleans without a stop at my favorite steak restaurant!
Steak was good

If you want the most unbelievable meal and service in New Orleans, go to Mr. John’s steak House and request Gindy as your server. Order The Who dat Shrimp as an appetizer, the filet or New York strip for main meal, and Freddie Mac and cheese for side!!!! Save room for dessert!!! The bread Pudding and Tiramasu are both good ncredible!!! This is a five star restaurant!!!! Gindy will take care of you!!! He is a great guy and made my birthday incredible!!! I will be back!!!
Best meal in years
(Translated by Google) Excellent.  (Original) Excelente.
Ugh

GREAT FOOD, but horribly noisey...the first clue came when our waiter first came over to our table and literally had to yell at us in order to be heard over the background noise...our dining experience was definitely NOT enhanced by the rowdy idiots at two nearby tables (it is not a big restaurant) who seemed to think that whatever they had to say was so important that every person in the room had to be able to hear them). The steaks we had were quality beef, cooked perfectly, the Wait Staff were friendly and professional, but we will not go back.
Amazing food and even better service. Well worth the wait and prices
Friendly servers and fast service.

It was amazing food. The service was great didn't want for a thing. It was loud however not loud enough not to go back. If you are anywhere within a 50 mile radius then I recommend a visit there. If not then you have missed an opportunity. Thanks for a great evening.

I've had many steaks, but none compare to the filet with the truffle butter, or the filet with melted Blue cheese on top. Absolutely decadent, delightful, and delicious. I will never forget, the night I put a Mr John's steakhouse steak in my mouth.

Food is good, service is good. It is very loud inside there. If you are looking for a quiet dinner, this is not the place to go. However, the resturaunt has two sides. If you request to sit on the left side it is quieter. Parking is a nightmare, especially during this time. With that being said, its still a 4 star for me.
The BEST STEAKS!!!!!!
Very good steak place! Will be back when in town to visit.
Great food. Great service. Premium price but good value.
Excellent service,food and atmosphere I can't wait to go back, be aware pretty expensive but we felt well worth it!!
Absolutely excellent! The meal, New York strip  steak was cooked to perfection. If you don't eat here while you are missing an excellent meal!
Amazing food and service as always.  Thank you
Nice place, steak house decor, live music on most nights. The food is very nice, they have a good selection of drink, make sure you don't leave without having desert!
Just a great place. Relaxed atmosphere, good food, and great service!
Great service, Excellent wine list and most all perfect steaks!
It's a steakhouse for folks who love steak.
Great food, great service, high end pricing
Some of the best steaks and tapas in the city. The dim lighting and small layout mixed with an amazing wait staff and wine selection give it a personal and romantic atmosphere.
Best steaks ib town.
Love it great service food is excellent
Steak was cooked well but thats about all i can say. It lacked seasoning didn't have much flavor and alot of fat.
Best food and service ... You want to see if a restaurant can be good order out from here excellent just as good !!!
The best steakhouse in the city.
The best steak ever.
Good food. Little on the high end
Best steak in town.

We had dinner at Mr Johns Steakhouse in April 2016 We had great expectations for a good steak but it wasn't there. Their New York Strip special was just a cheap grocery store steak. Tough  with no taste. Nowhere near the $ 48. they charged. The prices across the board were way high for the small portions and average food. I mentioned that the steak didn't live up to what we expected but all I got was a "sorry".  The service was good and the decor was real nice though.

Husband and I celebrated our 19th Wedding Anniversary there. ..from the Fresh-N-Hot French Bread, the On the House Annivesary specialty meatball w/marinara sauce sprinkled with parmesan cheese and parsley, Our Bacon Wrapped Shrimp,  our Superb cooked NY Strip,  Make you want to slap yo Mama Sweet Potato Soufle,  down right tasty Broccoli Casserole...the Overly Superior SERVICE of our Waiter .....making our Celebration an Absolutely Fabulous Experience! !!!!!! If ever in the area again Mr Johns Steakhouse will be on our must visit again list!!!!!!!💜💜💜💜💜💜

A friend of mine had not been to Mr. John's and we decided to go there.  Bar service great and then seated in Kevin's station (for the last time).  Steaks were like anywhere USA.  Kevin treated us like it was New York rush hour!  Looking for a dining experience and we're rushed out the door.  Ciao Mr. John's.....

This DID NOT live up to the hype. The atmosphere is bland, & seems to mimick other places in the area both local and afar. The mirrored panels, and framed photos hanging on the wall seemed dull & lackluster. The only thing I can say that was great, was the service. The waiters & staff were courteous, gave excellent service, and were attentive... Although I expect all of the above at any fine dining establishment. I had the surf & turf for my entree. The lobster was perfection; however, the steak lacked flavor of any sort. I would highly recommend a topping for any of their steaks if one chooses to dine here. Originally I wanted the steak without any additions as multiple friends had raved how good their steaks were & I wanted to taste this experience too. My fiancé had the cowboy steak and was disappointed with the quality as well. I feel there are far better establishments in NOLA for steak. The prices seemed inflated as the rating on Google for their restaurant. Look elsewhere for date night.

Just Another Steakhouse? - no big deal.  Until you have the experience of dining at Mr. John's Steakhouse, no big deal is the usual fare.  Fortunately, we had the opportunity during Mardi Gras to dine with friends at Mr. John's.  My husband and I travel frequently and dine in many famous and not so famous restaurants throughout the country, including some of the best in New York and San Francisco.  Mr. John's makes the top of our list in every category, especially in food taste and quality.  From the Peppercorn Crusted Yellowfin Tuna and Calamari appetizers, through our main dish and finally dessert, we were never disappointed.  Service was friendly and attentive but not over bearing.    Although expensive, when quality and service combine as they do here, the value is clearly there.

I ordered the waiter and he was beautifully cooked. His eyeballs were cooked in the way that they weren't dry. But they weren't wet. I also enjoyed his tongue. Over all it was very good but his intestines were over cooked.

Well we are back to NOLA for the 4th anniversary in a row. Also will he eating here again for the 4th year in a row. The best Steakhouse in Amercia. Period. I love everything about this place. Service is great. Food is even better. The Who Dat Shrimp is the bomb. The ribeye was like butter melting in your mouth! This place is a gem! I highly recommend to anyone. A little pricy but you get what you pay for.

Best NY strip I ever had, perfectly cooked to melt in my mouth. The who dat shrimp is also a must. Ask for Gindy if you want one of the most incredible dining experiences in New Orleans.  Great guy who really knows how to care for his guests, treats everyone like family.
Best steak in New Orleans
Great Food and Service, the New York Strip was pretty amazing, nice atmosphere as well, define try one of favorite steaks in New Orleans
Steak that rivals or exceeds ruths chris in nola (their origin)
Great place for dinner with friends. Food was great!
Food was flavorful. The restaurant was loud but still romantic.

The atmosphere is much about middle aged white professional males trying to out do each other in conversation.  The clientele is loud and boisterous.  This is not the place for a romantic date.  The Who Dat Shrimp appetizer was excellent. The Gulf Fish of the Day, grouper in this case, was light and delicious The Andouille, Crawfish Mac & Cheese was an absolute oily failure.  I ordered a blackened ribeye, but received a New York Strip.  As the waiter placed the dish in front of me, he said out loud "here's the blackened ribeye."  There is no confusing the two cuts -for me, or for a server working in a steak restaurant.  He assumed I was ignorant.  He intentionally lied about his error.  However, the steak was perfectly medium rare -as I ordered it.  The tiramisu was ordinary. The chocolate torte was rich. The coffee was good.  On pricing, the steaks are all near $40.  The meal above with an ice tea and two cocktails was $147 before the tip.
Super rich tasting good, fantastic
Great steak, a bit pricy with the accoutrements,  with good wine list
I love it. Great time
Best steakhouse in town
Best steaks in the south, top 5 in country

The two of us arrived at 7:00 and had a nice drink at the bar. We were seated at 7:30. That was fine. We were not served our main course (steak) until 10:00. Bill was over $250, too much for the wait. I didn't begrudge the $250, I begrudged the wait. This is a lazy and rude group. I live in NOLA, and this is not the way of the New Orleans restaurant tradition of good service and friendliness.
